info.title: Admin API
info.description: This API exposes the admin operations of a Restate cluster, such as registering new service deployments, interacting with running invocations, register Kafka subscriptions, retrieve service metadata. For an overview, check out the [Operate documentation](https://docs.restate.dev/operate/). If you're looking for how to call your services, check out the [Ingress HTTP API](https://docs.restate.dev/invoke/http) instead.

post.description: Create and register a new deployment. Restate will invoke the endpoint to gather additional information required for registration, such as the services exposed by the deployment. If the deployment is already registered, this method will return 200 and no changes will be made. If the deployment updates some already existing services, schema breaking changes checks will run. If you want to bypass them, use `breaking: true`. To overwrite an already existing deployment, use `force: true`

200.description: Already exists. No change if force = false, overwritten if force = true

delete.description: Delete deployment. Currently it's supported to remove a deployment only using the force flag

parameters.name: force
parameters.description: If true, the deployment will be forcefully deleted. This might break in-flight invocations, use with caution.

501.description: Not implemented. Only using the force flag is supported at the moment.

patch.description: Update an already existing deployment. This lets you update the address and options when invoking the deployment, such as the additional headers for HTTP or the assume role for Lambda. The registered services and handlers won't be overwritten, unless `overwrite: true`.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: If cancel, it will gracefully terminate the invocation. If kill, it will terminate the invocation with a hard stop. If purge, it will only cleanup the response for completed invocations, and leave unaffected an in-flight invocation.

patch.description: Cancel the given invocation. Canceling an invocation allows it to free any resources it is holding and roll back any changes it has made so far, running compensation code. For more details, checkout https://docs.restate.dev/guides/sagas

202.description: The cancellation signal was appended to the journal and will be processed by the SDK.

503 Service Unavailable.description: Error when routing the request within restate.

409 Conflict.description: The invocation was already completed, so it cannot be cancelled nor killed. You can instead purge the invocation, in order for restate to forget it.

patch.description: Kill the given invocation. This does not guarantee consistency for virtual object instance state, in-flight invocations to other services, etc.

503 Service Unavailable.description: Error when routing the request within restate.

409 Conflict.description: The invocation was already completed, so it cannot be cancelled nor killed. You can instead purge the invocation, in order for restate to forget it.

patch.description: Purge the given invocation. This cleanups all the state for the given invocation. This command applies only to completed invocations.

503 Service Unavailable.description: Error when routing the request within restate.

409 Conflict.description: The invocation is not yet completed. An invocation can be purged only when completed.

patch.description: Purge the given invocation journal. This cleanups only the journal for the given invocation, retaining the metadata. This command applies only to completed invocations.

503 Service Unavailable.description: Error when routing the request within restate.

409 Conflict.description: The invocation is not yet completed. An invocation can be purged only when completed.

patch.description: Restart the given invocation as new. This will restart the invocation as a new invocation with a different invocation id. By using the 'from' query parameter, some of the partial progress can be copied over to the new invocation.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: From which entry index the invocation should restart from. By default the invocation restarts from the beginning (equivalent to 'from = 0'), retaining only the input of the original invocation. When greater than 0, the new invocation will copy the old journal prefix up to 'from' included, plus eventual completions for commands in the given prefix. If the journal prefix contains commands that have not been completed, this operation will fail.

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.description: When restarting from journal prefix, provide a deployment id to use to replace the currently pinned deployment id. If 'latest', use the latest deployment id. If 'keep', keeps the pinned deployment id. When not provided, the invocation will resume on latest. Note: this parameter can be used only in combination with 'from'.

503 Service Unavailable.description: Error when routing the request within restate.

400 Bad Request.description:
The given journal index is out of range.
The given journal prefix contains some Commands without respective Completions.
The given deployment was not found.
The selected deployment id to restart as new the invocation doesn't support the currently pinned service protocol version.

409 Conflict.description:
The invocation is still running. An invocation can be restarted only when completed.
The invocation is still running or the deployment id is not pinned yet, deployment id cannot be changed. The deployment id can be changed only if the invocation is paused or suspended, and a deployment id is already pinned.

422 Unprocessable Entity.description: Restarting the invocation is not supported. Restarting workflows is not supported, and restarting invocations created using the old service protocol.

410 Gone.description: The invocation cannot be restarted because the input is not available. In order to restart an invocation, the journal must be available in order to read the input again. Journal can be retained after completion by enabling journal retention.

425 Too Early.description: The invocation cannot be restarted because it's not running yet, meaning it might have been scheduled or inboxed.

patch.description: Resume the given invocation. In case the invocation is backing-off, this will immediately trigger the retry timer. If the invocation is suspended or paused, this will resume it.

parameters.name: deployment
parameters.description: When resuming from paused/suspended, provide a deployment id to use to replace the currently pinned deployment id. If 'latest', use the latest deployment id. If 'keep', keeps the pinned deployment id. When not provided, the invocation will resume on the pinned deployment id. When provided and the invocation is either running, or no deployment is pinned, this operation will fail.

503 Service Unavailable.description: Error when routing the request within restate.

400 Bad Request.description:
The given deployment was not found.
The selected deployment id to resume the invocation doesn't support the currently pinned service protocol version.

425 Too Early.description: The invocation is either inboxed or scheduled. An invocation can be resumed only when running, paused or suspended.

409 Conflict.description:
The invocation is completed. An invocation can be resumed only when running, paused or suspended.
The invocation is still running or the deployment id is not pinned yet, deployment id cannot be changed. The deployment id can be changed only if the invocation is paused or suspended, and a deployment id is already pinned.

patch.description: Modify a registered service configuration. NOTE: Service re-discovery will update the settings based on the service endpoint configuration.

get.description: List all the handlers of the given service.
Get the handler of a service

additional_headers.title: Additional headers
additional_headers.description: Additional headers used to invoke this service deployment.

min_protocol_version.title: Minimum Service Protocol version
min_protocol_version.description: During registration, the SDKs declare a range from minimum (included) to maximum (included) Service Protocol supported version.

max_protocol_version.title: Maximum Service Protocol version
max_protocol_version.description: During registration, the SDKs declare a range from minimum (included) to maximum (included) Service Protocol supported version.

sdk_version.title: SDK version
sdk_version.description: SDK library and version declared during registration.

services.title: Services
services.description: List of services exposed by this deployment.

uri.title: Uri
uri.description: Uri to use to discover/invoke the http deployment.

additional_headers.title: Additional headers
additional_headers.description:
Additional headers added to every discover/invoke request to the deployment.

Fill this field with API Tokens and other authorization headers needed to send requests to the deployment.

use_http_11.title: Use http1.1
use_http_11.description: If `true`, discovery will be attempted using a client that defaults to HTTP1.1 instead of a prior-knowledge HTTP2 client. HTTP2 may still be used for TLS servers that advertise HTTP2 support via ALPN. HTTP1.1 deployments will only work in request-response mode.

breaking.title: Breaking
breaking.description:
If `true`, it allows registering new service revisions with schemas incompatible with previous service revisions, such as changing service type, removing a handler, etc.

See the [versioning documentation](https://docs.restate.dev/operate/versioning) for more information.

force.title: Force
force.description:
If `true`, it overrides, if existing, any deployment using the same `uri`. Beware that this can lead inflight invocations to an unrecoverable error state.

When set to `true`, it implies `breaking = true`.

See the [versioning documentation](https://docs.restate.dev/operate/versioning) for more information.

dry_run.title: Dry-run mode
dry_run.description: If `true`, discovery will run but the deployment will not be registered. This is useful to see the impact of a new deployment before registering it. `force` and `breaking` will be respected.

arn.title: ARN
arn.description: ARN to use to discover/invoke the lambda deployment.

assume_role_arn.title: Assume role ARN
assume_role_arn.description: Optional ARN of a role to assume when invoking the addressed Lambda, to support role chaining

additional_headers.title: Additional headers
additional_headers.description: Additional headers added to every discover/invoke request to the deployment.

breaking.title: Breaking
breaking.description:
If `true`, it allows registering new service revisions with schemas incompatible with previous service revisions, such as changing service type, removing a handler, etc.

See the [versioning documentation](https://docs.restate.dev/operate/versioning) for more information.

force.title: Force
force.description:
If `true`, it overrides, if existing, any deployment using the same `uri`. Beware that this can lead inflight invocations to an unrecoverable error state.

This implies `breaking = true`.

See the [versioning documentation](https://docs.restate.dev/operate/versioning) for more information.

dry_run.title: Dry-run mode
dry_run.description: If `true`, discovery will run but the deployment will not be registered. This is useful to see the impact of a new deployment before registering it. `force` and `breaking` will be respected.

min_protocol_version.title: Minimum Service Protocol version
min_protocol_version.description: During registration, the SDKs declare a range from minimum (included) to maximum (included) Service Protocol supported version.

max_protocol_version.title: Maximum Service Protocol version
max_protocol_version.description: During registration, the SDKs declare a range from minimum (included) to maximum (included) Service Protocol supported version.

sdk_version.title: SDK version
sdk_version.description: SDK library and version declared during registration.

name.title: Name
name.description: Fully qualified name of the service

documentation.title: Documentation
documentation.description: Documentation of the service, as propagated by the SDKs.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Additional service metadata, as propagated by the SDKs.

deployment_id.title: Deployment Id
deployment_id.description: Deployment exposing the latest revision of the service.

public.title: Public
public.description: If true, the service can be invoked through the ingress. If false, the service can be invoked only from another Restate service.

idempotency_retention.title: Idempotency retention
idempotency_retention.description:
The retention duration of idempotent requests for this service.

If not configured, this returns the default idempotency retention.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

workflow_completion_retention.title: Workflow completion retention
workflow_completion_retention.description:
The retention duration of workflows. Only available on workflow services.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

journal_retention.title: Journal retention
journal_retention.description:
The journal retention. When set, this applies to all requests to all handlers of this service.

In case the invocation has an idempotency key, the `idempotency_retention` caps the maximum `journal_retention` time. In case the invocation targets a workflow handler, the `workflow_completion_retention` caps the maximum `journal_retention` time.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

inactivity_timeout.title: Inactivity timeout
inactivity_timeout.description:
This timer guards against stalled service/handler invocations. Once it expires, Restate triggers a graceful termination by asking the service invocation to suspend (which preserves intermediate progress).

The 'abort timeout' is used to abort the invocation, in case it doesn't react to the request to suspend.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

If unset, this returns the default inactivity timeout configured in invoker options.

abort_timeout.title: Abort timeout
abort_timeout.description:
This timer guards against stalled service/handler invocations that are supposed to terminate. The abort timeout is started after the 'inactivity timeout' has expired and the service/handler invocation has been asked to gracefully terminate. Once the timer expires, it will abort the service/handler invocation.

This timer potentially **interrupts** user code. If the user code needs longer to gracefully terminate, then this value needs to be set accordingly.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

If unset, this returns the default abort timeout configured in invoker options.

enable_lazy_state.title: Enable lazy state
enable_lazy_state.description: If true, lazy state will be enabled for all invocations to this service. This is relevant only for Workflows and Virtual Objects.

allOf.title: Retry policy
allOf.description:
Retry policy applied to invocations of this service.

If unset, it returns the default values configured in the Restate configuration.

documentation.title: Documentation
documentation.description: Documentation of the handler, as propagated by the SDKs.

metadata.title: Metadata
metadata.description: Additional handler metadata, as propagated by the SDKs.

idempotency_retention.title: Idempotency retention
idempotency_retention.description:
The retention duration of idempotent requests for this handler. If set, it overrides the value set in the service.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

journal_retention.title: Journal retention
journal_retention.description:
The journal retention. When set, this applies to all requests to this handler.

In case the invocation has an idempotency key, the `idempotency_retention` caps the maximum `journal_retention` time. In case this handler is a workflow handler, the `workflow_completion_retention` caps the maximum `journal_retention` time.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

If set, it overrides the value set in the service.

inactivity_timeout.title: Inactivity timeout
inactivity_timeout.description:
This timer guards against stalled service/handler invocations. Once it expires, Restate triggers a graceful termination by asking the service invocation to suspend (which preserves intermediate progress).

The 'abort timeout' is used to abort the invocation, in case it doesn't react to the request to suspend.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

If set, it overrides the value set in the service.

abort_timeout.title: Abort timeout
abort_timeout.description:
This timer guards against stalled service/handler invocations that are supposed to terminate. The abort timeout is started after the 'inactivity timeout' has expired and the service/handler invocation has been asked to gracefully terminate. Once the timer expires, it will abort the service/handler invocation.

This timer potentially **interrupts** user code. If the user code needs longer to gracefully terminate, then this value needs to be set accordingly.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

If set, it overrides the value set in the service.

enable_lazy_state.title: Enable lazy state
enable_lazy_state.description:
If true, lazy state will be enabled for all invocations to this service. This is relevant only for Workflows and Virtual Objects.

If set, it overrides the value set in the service.

public.title: Public
public.description: If true, this handler can be invoked through the ingress. If false, this handler can be invoked only from another Restate service.

input_description.title: Human readable input description
input_description.description: If empty, no schema was provided by the user at discovery time.

output_description.title: Human readable output description
output_description.description: If empty, no schema was provided by the user at discovery time.

input_json_schema.title: Input JSON Schema
input_json_schema.description: JSON Schema of the handler input

output_json_schema.title: Output JSON Schema
output_json_schema.description: JSON Schema of the handler output

allOf.title: Retry policy
allOf.description: Retry policy overrides applied for this handler.

initial_interval.title: Initial Interval
initial_interval.description:
Initial interval for the first retry attempt.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

exponentiation_factor.title: Factor
exponentiation_factor.description: The factor to use to compute the next retry attempt.

max_attempts.title: Max attempts
max_attempts.description: Number of maximum attempts before giving up. Infinite retries if unset.

max_interval.title: Max interval
max_interval.description:
Maximum interval between retries.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

allOf.title: On max attempts
allOf.description: Behavior when max attempts are reached.

initial_interval.title: Initial Interval
initial_interval.description:
Initial interval for the first retry attempt.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

exponentiation_factor.title: Factor
exponentiation_factor.description: The factor to use to compute the next retry attempt. Default: `2.0`.

max_attempts.title: Max attempts
max_attempts.description: Number of maximum attempts (including the initial) before giving up. Infinite retries if unset. No retries if set to 1.

max_interval.title: Max interval
max_interval.description:
Maximum interval between retries.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

allOf.title: On max attempts
allOf.description: Behavior when max attempts are reached.

services.title: Services
services.description: List of services exposed by this deployment.

uri.title: Uri
uri.description: Uri to use to discover/invoke the http deployment.

additional_headers.title: Additional headers
additional_headers.description: Additional headers added to the discover/invoke requests to the deployment. When provided, this will overwrite all the headers previously configured for this deployment.

use_http_11.title: Use http1.1
use_http_11.description: If `true`, discovery will be attempted using a client that defaults to HTTP1.1 instead of a prior-knowledge HTTP2 client. HTTP2 may still be used for TLS servers that advertise HTTP2 support via ALPN. HTTP1.1 deployments will only work in request-response mode.

overwrite.title: Overwrite
overwrite.description: If `true`, the update will overwrite the schema information, including the exposed service and handlers and service configuration, allowing **breaking changes** too. Use with caution.

dry_run.title: Dry-run mode
dry_run.description: If `true`, discovery will run but the deployment will not be registered. This is useful to see the impact of a new deployment before registering it.

arn.title: ARN
arn.description: ARN to use to discover/invoke the lambda deployment.

assume_role_arn.title: Assume role ARN
assume_role_arn.description: Optional ARN of a role to assume when invoking the addressed Lambda, to support role chaining.

additional_headers.title: Additional headers
additional_headers.description: Additional headers added to the discover/invoke requests to the deployment. When provided, this will overwrite all the headers previously configured for this deployment.

overwrite.title: Overwrite
overwrite.description: If `true`, the update will overwrite the schema information, including the exposed service and handlers and service configuration, allowing **breaking changes** too. Use with caution.

dry_run.title: Dry-run mode
dry_run.description: If `true`, discovery will run but the deployment will not be registered. This is useful to see the impact of a new deployment before registering it.

new_invocation_id.description: The invocation id of the new invocation.

public.title: Public
public.description: If true, the service can be invoked through the ingress. If false, the service can be invoked only from another Restate service.

idempotency_retention.title: Idempotency retention
idempotency_retention.description:
Modify the retention of idempotent requests for this service.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

workflow_completion_retention.title: Workflow completion retention
workflow_completion_retention.description:
Modify the retention of the workflow completion. This can be modified only for workflow services!

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

journal_retention.title: Journal retention
journal_retention.description:
Modify the journal retention for this service. When set, this applies to all requests to all handlers of this service.

In case the invocation has an idempotency key, the `idempotency_retention` caps the maximum `journal_retention` time. In case the invocation targets a workflow handler, the `workflow_completion_retention` caps the maximum `journal_retention` time.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

inactivity_timeout.title: Inactivity timeout
inactivity_timeout.description:
This timer guards against stalled service/handler invocations. Once it expires, Restate triggers a graceful termination by asking the service invocation to suspend (which preserves intermediate progress).

The 'abort timeout' is used to abort the invocation, in case it doesn't react to the request to suspend.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

This overrides the default inactivity timeout set in invoker options.

abort_timeout.title: Abort timeout
abort_timeout.description:
This timer guards against stalled service/handler invocations that are supposed to terminate. The abort timeout is started after the 'inactivity timeout' has expired and the service/handler invocation has been asked to gracefully terminate. Once the timer expires, it will abort the service/handler invocation.

This timer potentially **interrupts** user code. If the user code needs longer to gracefully terminate, then this value needs to be set accordingly.

Can be configured using the [`jiff::fmt::friendly`](https://docs.rs/jiff/latest/jiff/fmt/friendly/index.html) format or ISO8601, for example `5 hours`.

This overrides the default abort timeout set in invoker options.

version.title: Version
version.description: If set, the latest version of the state is compared with this value and the operation will fail when the versions differ.

object_key.title: Service key
object_key.description: To what virtual object key to apply this change

new_state.description: The new state to replace the previous state with

min_admin_api_version.description: Minimum supported admin API version by the admin server

max_admin_api_version.title: Max admin API version
max_admin_api_version.description: Maximum supported admin API version by the admin server

ingress_endpoint.title: Ingress endpoint
ingress_endpoint.description: Ingress endpoint that the Web UI should use to interact with.
